title: Tomato, Arugula, and Ricotta Salata Salad
titleAlternative: Insalata di Pomodori e Ricotta Salata
introduction: This delightful salad combines sweet tomatoes, slightly bitter arugula, and semi-firm ricotta salata, offering a fresh and vibrant flavor profile. Ricotta salata, a pressed salted ricotta, works wonderfully here, though feta or crumbled gorgonzola can also be used.
ingredients: 2 large ripe tomatoes, cored and thinly sliced
2 thin slices red onion, separated into rings
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Trim the tough stems of the arugula and discard any yellowed or bruised leaves. Wash the arugula in several changes of cool water. Dry very well. Tear the arugula into bite-size pieces.
Arrange the tomatoes on a platter. Top with the arugula and onion rings. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
Sprinkle the ricotta salata over the salad. Serve immediately.
variations: Substitute ricotta salata with feta or crumbled gorgonzola if ricotta salata is not available.
